best.why: C earns its closing. The photography callback answers the 'is it art?' question the manifesto has been implicitly building toward since Section I, and it does so without over-explaining. 'Every generation asks again with a new machine' lands because it reframes AI as just the latest iteration — which is the manifesto's core move. The triple cadence ('We do not dam it and we do not drown') gives it a final rhythmic swell that matches the controlled aggression of the earlier sections. Crucially, it places 'We choose' before 'Nail this' — the declaration comes first, the call to action seals it. The 'ten thousand deletions' line ties back to the 1:10,000 ratio from Section V without repeating it verbatim. It closes the loop.

worst.why: A is a bumper sticker. After seven sections of layered argument — Gutenberg, Duchamp, the Global South — a closing that opens with 'Slop is cheap' feels like it forgot everything the manifesto just said. 'Make a practice inside the ruin' is strong in isolation but the section has no arc, no final turn. It's all exit line, no argument. The manifesto earned a more complex goodbye.

must_survive_line: The art was never in the tool. It was in the no.
